de.unisiegen.tpml.core.expressions
Class While

java.lang.Object
  de.unisiegen.tpml.core.expressions.Expression
      de.unisiegen.tpml.core.expressions.While
All Implemented Interfaces:
PrettyPrintPriorities, PrettyPrintable, Cloneable
public final class While
extends Expression

Instances of this class represent while expressions in the expression hierarchy that serve as syntactic sugar introduce with the imperative concepts.

Version:
$Rev: 698 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
Expression

clone

public While clone()
Clones this expression, so that the result is an expression equal to this expression, but with a different object identity. This is used in the substitution of expressions to be able to distinguish different appearances of the same identifier in the pretty printer, as required by the highlighting of bound variables. But note that for certain kinds of Expressions, like Constants, this method returns the same object, as constants are not affected by the highlighting of bound variables.

Specified by:
clone in class Expression
Returns:
a deep clone of this object, or a reference to this if the expression is a constant or another special kind of expression not affected by the highlighting of bound variables.
See Also:
Expression.clone()

substitute

public Expression substitute(TypeSubstitution substitution)
Applies the type substitution to this expression, to be exact, to the types within this expression, and returns the new expression with the new types. If the expression does not contain any types, this method simply returns a reference to this expression.

Overrides:
substitute in class Expression
Parameters:
substitution - the type substitution to apply.
Returns:
the resulting expression.
See Also:
Expression.substitute(de.unisiegen.tpml.core.typechecker.TypeSubstitution)

substitute

public Expression substitute(String id,
                             Expression e)
Substitutes the expression e for the identifier id in this expression, and returns the resulting expression. The resulting expression may be a new Expression object or if no substitution took place, the same object. The method operates recursively.

Specified by:
substitute in class Expression
Parameters:
id - the name of the identifier.
e - the Expression to substitute.
Returns:
the resulting expression.
See Also:
Expression.substitute(java.lang.String, de.unisiegen.tpml.core.expressions.Expression)

toPrettyStringBuilder

public PrettyStringBuilder toPrettyStringBuilder(PrettyStringBuilderFactory factory)
Returns the pretty string builder used to pretty print this expression. The pretty string builder must be allocated from the specified factory, which is currently always the default factory, but may also be another factory in the future.

Specified by:
toPrettyStringBuilder in class Expression
Parameters:
factory - the PrettyStringBuilderFactory used to allocate the required pretty string builders to pretty print this expression.
Returns:
the pretty string builder used to pretty print this expression.
See Also:
Expression.toPrettyStringBuilder(de.unisiegen.tpml.core.prettyprinter.PrettyStringBuilderFactory)
